LabelÂ¶

struct asmjit::Label
#include <defs.h>

Label (jump target or data location).

Label represents locations typically used as jump targets, but may be also used as position where are stored constants or static variables. If you want to use Label you need first to associate it with BaseAssembler or BaseCompiler instance. To create new label use BaseAssembler::newLabel() or BaseCompiler::newLabel().

Example of using labels:

 // Create Assembler/Compiler.
 Assembler a;

 // Create Label instance.
 Label L_1(a);

 // ... your code ...

 // Using label, see @ref asmjit::BaseAssembler or @ref asmjit::BaseCompiler.
 a.jump(L_1);

 // ... your code ...

 // Bind label to current position, see @ref asmjit::BaseAssembler::bind()
 // or @ref asmjit::BaseCompiler::bind().
 a.bind(L_1);

Public Functions

Label()

Create new, unassociated label.

Label(uint32_t id)

Label(BaseAssembler & a)

Create new initialized label.

Label(BaseCompiler & c)

Create new initialized label.

Label(const Label & other)

Create reference to another label.
